chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac VALDEZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant in custody.

The Court orders the defendant to undergo a psychological evaluation prior to hearing this motion.  The Court feels the information will be helpful in deciding the motion.
The parties have no problem with Skip Cole doing the evaluation.  Attorney Scharenbroch is to draft the order.

records.addlTxt:
BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2nd degree sexual assault of child, 2 counts repeated sexual assault of child, 3 counts child enticement, 3 counts use of computer to facilitate a sex crime, 2 counts distribute THC to person under 18 and 3 counts felony bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 11-02-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash for victim BAD; $5000.00 cash for victim LMA and $4,000.00 cash for victim AV.  Total of $14,000.00 cash bail with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, provide a DNA sample, no use of an internet enabled device, maintain absolute sobriety and no contact with BAD, DOB: 04-11-2000; LMA, DOB: 08-15-2001; AV, DOB: 02-27-2002 or anyone under the age of 18.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.
Minutes.
Minutes.
